clinical_study.brief_title: Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasm With Malignant Change
clinical_study.official_title: Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasm (IPMN) With Malignant Change: Prospective Study to Assess Diagnostic Performance of CT and Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MR) According to International Consensus Guidelines 2012

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose:
To investigate diagnostic performance of CT and MR in intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm with malignant change according to international consensus guidelines 2012.
Hypothesis: According to 2012 consensus guidelines, enhanced solid component and main pancreatic duct size of larger than 10 mm will be significant.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Purpose
- To investigate diagnostic performance of CT and MR in intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm with malignant change according to international consensus guidelines 2012
2. Enroll criteria
- Patient who is suspected to have pancreas IPMN on imaging
- Interval between imaging study and surgery is less than 2 months
- Who is scheduled for surgery due to IPMN

clinical_study.why_stopped: Because patient enrollment is so difficult.

primary_outcome.measure: Imaging predictor of malignant IPMN of the pancreas
primary_outcome.description: We will assess baseline CT and MRI findings of patients within one month after surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Patents who are suspected to have pancreas IPMN by clinicians or imaging studies

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who is suspected to have IPMN by imaging study or clinician
- Time interval between imaging study and surgery less than 2 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have pathology results not by surgery
- Who is less than 20 years old
- Who cannot voluntarily agree study design
